column7: General Information
column9: Initiative from the undisclosed GRI (found by the coder but not mentioned in the GRI index table)

column7: GPT is one of Australia's leading property groups, with assets under management of $32.6 billion across a portfolio of high-quality retail, office, and logistics assets.

column6: Entities included in the organization's sustainability reporting
column7: The GPT Group (GPT) is a stapled entity comprised of the General Property Trust (the Trust) and its controlled entities and GPT Management Holdings Limited (the Company) and its controlled entities.

column6: Reporting period, frequency, and contact point
column7: The Board approved the 2023 Annual Report on 19 February 2024. The statutory reporting elements of the Directors' Report for the year ended 31 December 2023, including the Operating and Financial Review, have been prepared by the Corporations Act 2001.

The 31 December 2022 balances of derivative assets and liabilities have been restated to reflect a correction of an immaterial error in determining the current and non-current portions of the balances. The total derivative valuation remains unchanged.

During the year, PricewaterhouseCoopers, GPT's auditor, performed other services besides their statutory duties. Details of the amounts paid to the auditor, including those paid for non-audit and other assurance services.

column6: Activities, value chain and other business relationships
column7: GPT owns and manages a diversified portfolio of high-quality properties across Australia, ranging from 30 offices, 16 shopping centres, and 72 logistics assets.

GPT invests in talent and their development, enhancing organisational capability, growth, and innovation. GPT's newly launched purpose and values enhance people's alignment on how their role connects to our strategy and goals.

The Board has established the Audit Committee, Human Resources and Remuneration Committee, Nomination Committee and Sustainability and Risk Committee to assist in carrying out its responsibilities. The Board also establishes special purpose committees as may be required to focus on specific matters.

column6: Nomination and selection of the highest governance body
column7: The Nomination Committee's role is to assist the Board in fulfilling its corporate governance responsibilities regarding Non-Executive Director and CEO appointments and succession, Board induction, development, and performance.

column6: Chair of the highest governance body
column7: Vickki McFadden is the Chairman for the FY23 reporting period.

column6: Role of the highest governance body in overseeing the management of impacts
column7: The GPT Board strives to ensure that GPT meets high governance standards across its operations. The Board and its Committees review governance arrangements and practices to ensure they remain appropriate.

column6: Delegation of responsibility for managing impacts
column7: The Board oversees the application and management of the Risk Management Framework and the Group's Environmental Management System (EMS) to ensure that climate change, nature and other sustainability-related financial and environmental risks and impacts are appropriately identified and assessed.

column6: Role of the highest governance body in sustainability reporting
column7: Management has established particular purpose committees and working groups to focus on specific sustainability matters, with reporting provided to the Board and its Committees as required.

Directors are required to take all reasonable steps to avoid actual, potential or perceived conflicts of interest and, should a dispute arise, declare it to the Chairman of the Board, or if the conflict involves the Chairman of the Board, the Chairman of the Audit Committee.

GPT has a Whistleblower Policy that encourages the reporting of any misconduct, including contraventions of legal obligations, dishonest, corrupt, fraudulent, or illegal conduct, conduct posing a severe risk to health and safety, unethical behaviour, bullying, discrimination, sexual harassment, or victimisation.

column6: Collective knowledge of the highest governance body
column7: The Board is committed to ensuring that it has a mix of skills, experience, expertise and diversity to enable it to discharge its responsibilities. The Board also seeks to have a mix of tenure for its Directors to balance those who have established knowledge of GPT's business and history with those who bring a fresh perspective and different insights.

column6: Evaluation of the performance of the highest governance body
column7: GPT is a high governance body evaluated annually through an annual Board and Committee appraisal process.

GPT's Remuneration Framework is designed to support the Group's strategy and reward our people for their successful execution and performance. The framework's foundation is the Remuneration Principles, which describe how to create value for stakeholders.
GPT's remuneration process is determined through fixed remuneration, short and long-term incentives, and employee ownership plans.
The total compensation for Key Management Personnel (KMP) for FY23 was $5,146,233.

"Leadership in sustainability is an important pillar of GPT's strategy. Our sustainability goals and efforts align to being a positive contributor to our people, communities, stakeholders and the environment, and take a restorative approach to addressing the residual environmental impacts of our direct activities."

column13: GPT implements innovative Green leases, integrating environmentally sustainable practices into their property agreements. These leases promote energy efficiency and eco-friendly initiatives, aligning with GPT's commitment to sustainability in the real estate sector.
column20: Green leases, Tenant GHG emissions, Supporting tenants

column7: The Group's carbon-neutral commitment is delivered by running efficient buildings on renewable electricity and offsetting the emissions we cannot eliminate through a combination of energy and Australian nature-based reforestation offsets.

column13: GPT has instituted a Compulsory Training Program, mandating all employees to undergo skill enhancement sessions and compliance training. This initiative underscores GPT's commitment to fostering a knowledgeable workforce and upholding industry standards.
column20: Compulsory Training Program, supplier due diligence, modern \nslavery e-learning module

column6: Mechanisms for seeking advice and raising concern

column7: GPT is a member of Advancing Net Zero, the World Green Building Council, Climate Group EP100, Climate Active, the UN Global Compact, the SDGs, TNFD, and PRI.

column13: GPT has implemented Voice of the Customer Programs, actively soliciting client feedback to tailor its services effectively and meet customer needs. These programs reflect GPT's dedication to customer satisfaction and continuous improvement in delivering top-notch real estate solutions.
column20: Voice of the Customer Programs, local community groups, engaging with stakeholder

column13: GPT hosts Sector Outlook Seminars, offering insights into the latest trends and developments shaping the real estate industry. These seminars provide valuable perspectives for investors, stakeholders, and industry professionals, facilitating informed decision-making in the dynamic market landscape.
column20: Sector outlook seminars, regular surveys, relationship managers

column13: GPT offers Tenant Intranets, providing a centralised platform for tenants to access essential resources, communicate with property management, and stay informed about building amenities and services. These intranets streamline tenant interactions and enhance satisfaction by fostering transparent and efficient communication channels.
column20: Tenant intranets, Connecting with tenants, management committee meetings
